(&#8220;Pfizer&#8221;) issued a press release announcing its financial results for the </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">second quarter</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"> of </span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;text-align:center;">2020</span><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">. style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">The information furnished pursuant to this &#8220;Item 2.02 - Results of Operations and Financial Condition&#8221;, including Exhibit 99, shall not be deemed to be &#8220;filed&#8221; for the purposes of Section 18 of the Securities Exchange Act of 1934, as amended (&#8220;Exchange Act&#8221;) or otherwise subject to the liabilities of that section, and shall not be deemed to be incorporated by reference into any filing made by us under the Exchange Act or Securities Act of 1933, as amended, regardless of any general incorporation language in any such filing, except as shall be expressly set forth by specific reference in such filing.</span></div><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:10pt;"><span style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;"><br/></span></div><div Excluding the Impact from Consumer Healthcare</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;"><sup style="vertical-align:top;line-height:120%;font-size:7pt">(1)</sup></font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">, Revenues Declined </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">3%</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;Operationally</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:4px;padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:48px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:24px;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#8211;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">31%</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;Operational Decline from Upjohn, Primarily Due to U.S. Loss of Exclusivity of Lyrica in 2019, Partially Offset by 17% Operational Growth in China, Primarily Due to Lipitor and Norvasc</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:12px;padding-bottom:12px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:24px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:0px;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#9642;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">Second-Quarter</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;text-align:center;">2020</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;Reported Diluted EPS</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;"><sup style="vertical-align:top;line-height:120%;font-size:7pt">(2)</sup></font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">$0.61</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">, Adjusted Diluted EPS</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;"><sup style="vertical-align:top;line-height:120%;font-size:7pt">(3)</sup></font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">$0.78</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:12px;padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:24px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:0px;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#9642;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">Raised Midpoint of 2020 Financial Guidance for Revenues by $0.1 Billion to </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">$48.6 to $50.6 Billion</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;and Adjusted Diluted EPS</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;"><sup style="vertical-align:top;line-height:120%;font-size:7pt">(3)</sup></font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;by $0.03 to </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">$2.85 to $2.95</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">; Reaffirmed All Other 2020 Financial Guidance Components</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:12px;padding-bottom:12px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:24px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:120%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:0px;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#9642;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:120%;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">Initiated Four Different Registration-Enabling Vaccine Candidate Programs Since May 2020, Including for Pneumococcal 20-Valent in Infants, Meningococcal Pentavalent, Respiratory Syncytial Virus and for COVID-19, Which Started Dosing Patients in the U.S. Yesterday</font></div></td></tr></table><div><a name="s0C69A21697945C6F9BE93912D199399D"></a></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:8px;padding-top:20px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">NEW YORK, NY, </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">Tuesday, July&#160;28, 2020</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;&#8211; Pfizer Inc. (NYSE: PFE) reported financial results for </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">second-quarter</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;text-align:center;">2020</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">, increased its 2020 financial guidance for revenues and Adjusted diluted EPS</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;"><sup style="vertical-align:top;line-height:120%;font-size:7pt">(3)</sup></font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;and reaffirmed all other components of its 2020 financial guidance, which continues to reflect actual and anticipated business impacts from the novel coronavirus disease of 2019 (COVID-19) pandemic.</font></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:8px;padding-top:0px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">Results for the </font><font style="vertical-align:middle;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">(34%)</font></div></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:middle;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div #000000;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="overflow:hidden;height:5px;font-size:10pt;"><font #000000;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="overflow:hidden;height:5px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:bottom;border-bottom:1.5px solid #000000;padding-left:2px;padding-top:2px;padding-bottom:2px;padding-right:2px;"><div style="overflow:hidden;height:5px;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#160;</font></div></td></tr></table></div></div><div><br></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:0px;padding-top:0px;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">- </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">1</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;-</font></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:12px;padding-top:8px;text-align:center;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:12px;padding-top:8px;text-align:center;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;"><br></font></div></div><div><br></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:16px;padding-top:16px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">Beginning in 2020, Upjohn began managing Pfizer&#8217;s Meridian subsidiary, the manufacturer of EpiPen and other auto-injector products, and a pre-existing strategic collaboration between Pfizer and Mylan N.V. (Mylan) for generic drugs in Japan (Mylan-Japan). To facilitate comparison across periods, revenues and expenses associated with Meridian and Mylan-Japan are reported in Pfizer&#8217;s Upjohn business in all periods presented.</font></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:16px;padding-top:16px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">Acquisitions and other business development activities completed in 2019 and in the first half of 2020 impacted financial results in the periods presented</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;"><sup style="vertical-align:top;line-height:120%;font-size:7pt">(1)</sup></font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">. Some amounts in this press release may not add due to rounding. All percentages have been calculated using unrounded amounts. References to operational variances pertain to period-over-period growth rates that exclude the impact of foreign exchange</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;"><sup style="vertical-align:top;line-height:120%;font-size:7pt">(5)</sup></font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">.</font></div><div><a name="s273C6B60CA505933A52B29171F49D7C1"></a></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:12px;padding-top:32px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:11pt;color:#000000;font-style:normal;font-weight:bold;text-decoration:none;">IMPACT OF COVID-19 ON BUSINESS ACTIVITIES AND FINANCIAL RESULTS</font></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:8px;padding-top:12px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">As a result of the COVID-19 pandemic, Pfizer continues to take proactive steps intended to protect the health and safety of colleagues, to maintain supply of Pfizer medicines and vaccines to patients and to continue to advance Pfizer&#8217;s pipeline.</font></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:16px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:11pt;color:#000000;font-style:normal;font-weight:bold;text-decoration:none;">Colleague Health and Safety</font></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:12px;padding-top:8px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">At this time, Pfizer colleagues in most locations who are able to perform their job functions outside of a Pfizer facility continue to work remotely. Certain Pfizer colleagues, primarily those in the Pfizer Global Supply and Worldwide Research and Development organizations, have roles whose physical presence at Pfizer facilities is required to perform their job functions. These colleagues continue to report to work and are subject to strict protocols intended to reduce the risk of transmission, including social distancing, maintaining contact logs, increased cleaning and use of personal protective equipment as necessary.</font></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:16px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:11pt;color:#000000;font-style:normal;font-weight:bold;text-decoration:none;">Manufacturing</font></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:12px;padding-top:8px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">To date, Pfizer has not seen a significant disruption in its supply chain, and all of its manufacturing sites around the world have continued to operate at or near normal levels. In addition, Pfizer has taken steps to scale up manufacturing operations at risk to accelerate its ability to supply a potential novel treatment or vaccine for COVID-19.</font></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:16px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:11pt;color:#000000;font-style:normal;font-weight:bold;text-decoration:none;">Clinical Trials</font></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:12px;padding-top:8px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">After a brief pause to the recruitment portion of certain ongoing clinical studies and a delay to most new study starts, in late-April 2020, Pfizer restarted recruitment across the development portfolio, including new study starts. Pfizer continues to work closely with clinical trial sites to understand their needs and is performing remote monitoring where appropriate to oversee study conduct. In addition, processes to enable tele-health and home healthcare are being utilized where appropriate to continue the data collection process and support patient safety.</font></div><div><br></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:0px;padding-top:0px;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">- </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">2</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;-</font></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:12px;padding-top:8px;text-align:center;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:12px;padding-top:8px;text-align:center;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;"><br></font></div></div><div><br></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:16px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:11pt;color:#000000;font-style:normal;font-weight:bold;text-decoration:none;">Sales and Marketing</font></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:12px;padding-top:8px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">Pfizer has experienced an impact on its sales and marketing activities due to widespread restrictions on in-person meetings with healthcare professionals and the refocused attention of the medical community on fighting COVID-19. Access to prescribers for sales force colleagues during second-quarter 2020 was mixed, with those in most international markets able to meet with healthcare professionals for most of the quarter, while those in the U.S. were unable to meet in-person with doctors for nearly all of the quarter. At this time, no U.S. sales force colleagues are meeting in-person with healthcare professionals due to COVID-19-related safety concerns. Pfizer is actively reviewing and assessing epidemiological data and colleagues remain ready to resume in-person engagements with healthcare professionals on a location-by-location basis as soon as it is safe to do so.</font></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:12px;padding-top:8px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">As a result of the lower number of in-person meetings with prescribers and restrictions on patient movements due to government-mandated work-from-home or shelter-in-place policies, the rate of new prescriptions for certain products and of vaccination rates for most vaccines slowed in certain markets, including the U.S., which negatively impacted second-quarter 2020 financial results. These declines were partially offset by certain Pfizer medicines and vaccines that saw increased demand in certain markets compared to the prior-year quarter, including Prevenar 13 for </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;font-style:italic;">streptococcus pneumoniae</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;in adults in international markets as well as certain sterile injectable products utilized in the intubation and ongoing treatment of mechanically-ventilated COVID-19 patients.</font></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:16px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:11pt;color:#000000;font-style:normal;font-weight:bold;text-decoration:none;">Financial Condition and Access to Capital Markets</font></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:0px;padding-top:0px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">Due to Pfizer&#8217;s significant operating cash flows, as well as its financial assets, access to capital markets and revolving credit agreements, Pfizer believes it has, and will maintain, the ability to meet liquidity needs for the foreseeable future.</font></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:0px;padding-top:16px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">Pfizer will continue to pursue efforts to maintain the continuity of its operations while monitoring for new developments related to the COVID-19 pandemic, which are unpredictable. Future COVID-19 developments could result in additional favorable or unfavorable impacts on Pfizer&#8217;s business, operations or financial condition.</font></div><div><a name="sB447E278BEFB5440A614F2814E7D3244"></a></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:12px;padding-top:8px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;text-align:center;">2020</font><font style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:11pt;color:#000000;font-style:normal;font-weight:bold;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:11pt;color:#000000;font-style:normal;font-weight:bold;text-decoration:none;">FINANCIAL GUIDANCE</font><font style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:11pt;color:#000000;font-style:normal;font-weight:bold;text-decoration:none;"><sup style="vertical-align:top;line-height:120%;font-size:7pt">(6)</sup>&#160;</font></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:8px;padding-top:12px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">Pfizer increased its 2020 financial guidance for Total Company</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;"><sup style="vertical-align:top;line-height:120%;font-size:7pt">(7)</sup></font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;and New Pfizer</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;"><sup style="vertical-align:top;line-height:120%;font-size:7pt">(8)</sup></font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;revenues and Adjusted diluted EPS</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;"><sup style="vertical-align:top;line-height:120%;font-size:7pt">(3)</sup></font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;and reaffirmed all other financial guidance components.</font></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:8px;padding-top:12px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">Financial guidance reflects management&#8217;s current expectations for operational performance, foreign exchange rates as well as various COVID-19-related uncertainties, primarily those related to the severity, duration and global macroeconomic impact of the pandemic. Key guidance assumptions regarding these uncertainties broadly reflect an ongoing, gradual global recovery from the first-half 2020 macroeconomic and healthcare impacts of the COVID-19 pandemic. Specific COVID-19-related assumptions include:</font></div><div><br></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:0px;padding-top:0px;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">- </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">3</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;-</font></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:12px;padding-top:8px;text-align:center;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:12px;padding-top:8px;text-align:center;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;"><br></font></div></div><div><br></div><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:16px;padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:30px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:174%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:6px;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#9642;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:174%;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">Patient visits with physicians, vaccination rates and the number of elective surgical procedures will gradually increase from second-quarter 2020 levels, beginning in third-quarter 2020;</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:16px;padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:30px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:174%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:6px;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#9642;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:174%;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">New-to-brand prescription trends for certain key products will gradually improve from second-quarter 2020 levels, beginning in third-quarter 2020;</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:16px;padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; Roman;font-size:11pt;color:#000000;font-style:normal;font-weight:bold;text-decoration:none;">CAPITAL ALLOCATION</font></div><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:16px;padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:30px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:174%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:6px;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#9642;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:174%;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">During </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">the first six months of</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;text-align:center;">2020</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">, Pfizer paid </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">$4.2 billion</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;of dividends, composed of dividends of $0.38 per share of common stock in each of the first and second quarters of 2020.</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:16px;padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:30px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:174%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:6px;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#9642;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:174%;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">No share repurchases have been completed to date in 2020. As of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">July&#160;28, 2020</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">, Pfizer&#8217;s remaining share repurchase authorization was </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">$5.3 billion</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">. No share repurchases are currently planned in 2020.</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:16px;padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:30px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:174%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:6px;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#9642;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:174%;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">The </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">second-quarter</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;text-align:center;">2020</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;diluted weighted-average shares used to calculate earnings per common share was </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">5,619 million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;shares, a reduction of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">53 million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;shares compared to </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">second-quarter</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">2019</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">.</font></div></td></tr></table><div><br></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:0px;padding-top:0px;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">- </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">5</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;-</font></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div><a name="sA3F0010688A85BDB86FF51099E567F8B"></a></div><div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:12px;padding-top:8px;text-align:center;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:12px;padding-top:8px;text-align:center;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;"><br></font></div></div><div><br></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:12px;padding-top:32px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:11pt;color:#000000;font-style:normal;font-weight:bold;text-decoration:none;">EXECUTIVE COMMENTARY</font></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:12px;padding-top:8px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">Dr. Albert Bourla, Pfizer&#8217;s Chairman and Chief Executive Officer, stated, &#8220;We remain fully committed to confronting the public health challenge posed by the COVID-19 pandemic by collaborating with industry partners and academic institutions to develop potential approaches to prevent and treat COVID-19. Our researchers and scientists have made important progress toward developing an effective vaccine though significant additional work remains. I want to thank all of our R&amp;D colleagues who continue to work tirelessly to find a potential vaccine and treatments that could bring an end to this pandemic. I would also like to acknowledge the remarkable job that our manufacturing team has done throughout this crisis to ensure our medicines continue to reach patients in need.</font></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:12px;padding-top:8px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#8220;Our strong performance in the first half of the year highlights the resiliency of our business even during the most challenging times. The Biopharma business grew </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">9%</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;operationally in the first six months of the year, driven by strong performances from many key brands. Upjohn faced the expected headwind of generic competition for Lyrica in the U.S. that was partially offset by strong performance in China in second-quarter 2020. We continue to progress toward a successful close of our transaction with Mylan, now expected in the fourth quarter of 2020,&#8221; Dr. Bourla concluded.</font></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:12px;padding-top:8px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">Frank D&#8217;Amelio, Chief Financial Officer and Executive Vice President, Business Operations and Global Supply, stated, &#8220;We raised the midpoint of our 2020 financial guidance range for revenues and Adjusted diluted EPS</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;"><sup style="vertical-align:top;line-height:120%;font-size:7pt">(3)</sup></font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;for Total Company</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;"><sup style="vertical-align:top;line-height:120%;font-size:7pt">(7)</sup></font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;and for New Pfizer</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;"><sup style="vertical-align:top;line-height:120%;font-size:7pt">(8)</sup></font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;while reaffirming the ranges for all other financial guidance components. While our near-term outlook has greater macroeconomic uncertainty than usual due to COVID-19, we are confident that the long-term outlook for our businesses remains solid. Overall, I was pleased with our financial performance in second-quarter 2020, which demonstrated the durability of our business despite the challenges that the COVID-19 pandemic has presented. </font></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:12px;padding-top:8px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#8220;Despite the ongoing impact of COVID-19, 2020 is still expected to be a transformational year for Pfizer. Following the pending close of the Upjohn-Mylan transaction, now expected in fourth-quarter 2020, New Pfizer will be positioned to deliver revenue and Adjusted diluted EPS</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;"><sup style="vertical-align:top;line-height:120%;font-size:7pt">(3)</sup></font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;growth that is expected to be among the industry leaders. New Pfizer will be a smaller, science-based company with a singular focus on innovation while also continuing to allocate significant capital directly to shareholders, primarily through dividends,&#8221; Mr. D&#8217;Amelio concluded.</font></div><div><br></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:0px;padding-top:0px;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">- </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">6</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;-</font></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div><a name="s6072F622AA6A5BA890B72F222BECA7DD"></a></div><div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:12px;padding-top:8px;text-align:center;font-size:11pt;"><font Roman;font-size:11pt;color:#000000;font-style:normal;font-weight:bold;text-decoration:none;">) </font></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:12px;padding-top:8px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">Second-quarter</font><font totaled </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">$11.8 billion</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">, a decrease of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">$1.5 billion</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">, or </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">11%</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">, compared to the prior-year quarter, reflecting an operational decline of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">$1.2 billion</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">, or </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">9%</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">, as well as the unfavorable impact of foreign exchange of </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">$277 million</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">, or </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">2%</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">. Excluding the impact of Consumer Healthcare</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;"><sup style="vertical-align:top;line-height:120%;font-size:7pt">(1)</sup></font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">, revenues declined </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">3%</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;operationally compared to the prior-year quarter.</font></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:16px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:11pt;color:#000000;font-style:normal;font-weight:bold;text-decoration:none;">Impact of COVID-19 on</font><font style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:11pt;color:#000000;font-style:normal;font-weight:bold;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;font-weight:bold;text-align:center;">2020</font><font included an estimated net </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">unfavorable impact of approximately $500 million, or 4%, due to COVID-19, primarily reflecting unfavorable disruptions to wellness visits for pediatric and adult patients in the U.S. and lower demand for certain products in China, partially offset by increased U.S. demand for certain sterile injectable products as well as increased adult demand for Prevenar 13 in certain international markets.</font></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:16px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:11pt;color:#000000;font-style:normal;font-weight:bold;text-decoration:none;">Biopharma Revenue Highlights</font></div><div revenues totaled </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">$9.8 billion</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">, up </font><font font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:30px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:174%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:6px;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#9642;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:174%;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">the Hospital business in the U.S., up </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;text-transform:default;">13%</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">, primarily driven by increased demand for certain sterile injectable products utilized in the intubation and ongoing treatment of mechanically-ventilated COVID-19 patients as well as continued growth from Panzyga following its November 2018 U.S. launch;</font></div></td></tr></table><div><br></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="line-height:120%;padding-bottom:0px;padding-top:0px;text-align:center;font-size:10pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">- </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">7</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:10pt;">&#32;-</font></div></div><hr style="page-break-after:always"><div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:12px;padding-top:8px;text-align:center;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;"><br></font></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:12px;padding-top:8px;text-align:center;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;"><br></font></div></div><div><br></div><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:16px;padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; and</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:16px;padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:30px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:174%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:6px;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#9642;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:174%;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">Xtandi in the U.S., up </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">32%</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">, primarily driven by continued strong demand in the metastatic and non-metastatic castration-resistant prostate cancer indications as well as the metastatic castration-sensitive prostate cancer indication, which was approved in the U.S. in December 2019,</font></div></td></tr></table><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:16px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">partially offset primarily by lower revenues for:</font></div><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:16px;padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:30px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:174%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:6px;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#9642;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:174%;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">Prevnar 13 in the U.S., down </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">22%</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">, primarily reflecting the expected unfavorable impact of disruptions to wellness visits for pediatric and adult patients due to COVID-19-related mobility restrictions or limitations, partially offset by the favorable impact of timing associated with government purchases for the pediatric indication, compared to the prior-year quarter;</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:16px;padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:30px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:174%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:6px;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#9642;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:174%;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">the Hospital business in emerging markets, down </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;text-transform:default;">14%</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;operationally, primarily driven by lower demand for certain anti-infective products in China due to lower infection rates driven by fewer elective surgical procedures, shorter in-patient hospital stays and improved infection control compared to the prior-year quarter;</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:16px;padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:30px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:174%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:6px;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#9642;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:174%;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">Enbrel internationally, down </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;text-transform:default;">16%</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;operationally, primarily reflecting continued biosimilar competition in most developed Europe markets as well as in Japan and Brazil;</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:16px;padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:30px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:174%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:6px;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#9642;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:174%;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">Chantix in the U.S., down </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">21%</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">, primarily reflecting expected lower demand resulting from reduced doctor visits, including wellness visits when Chantix is typically prescribed, due to COVID-19-related mobility restrictions or limitations; and</font></div></td></tr></table><table cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" style="padding-top:16px;padding-bottom:4px;font-family:Times New Roman; font-size:10pt;"><tr><td style="width:30px;"></td><td></td></tr><tr><td style="vertical-align:top"><div style="line-height:174%;font-size:11pt;padding-left:6px;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#9642;</font></div></td><td style="vertical-align:top;"><div style="line-height:174%;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">Ibrance in developed Europe, down </font><font style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:11pt;color:#000000;">10%</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;operationally, primarily reflecting continued strong demand, more than offset by pricing pressures in certain markets.</font></div></td></tr></table><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:16px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:Times New Roman;font-size:11pt;color:#000000;font-style:normal;font-weight:bold;text-decoration:none;">Upjohn Revenue Highlights</font></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:16px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">Second-quarter</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;text-align:center;">2020</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;Upjohn revenues totaled </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">$2.0 billion</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">, down </font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">31%</font><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">&#32;operationally, primarily driven by the expected significant volume declines for Lyrica in the U.S. due to multi-source generic competition that began in July 2019. Excluding the impact of Lyrica in the U.S., Upjohn revenues declined 6% operationally.</font></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:16px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">Second-quarter 2020 Upjohn revenues in China grew 17% operationally, primarily driven by Lipitor and Norvasc. First-half 2020 Upjohn revenues in China declined 21% operationally.</font></div><div><br></div><div style="text-align:center;"><div style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">* Indicates calculation is greater than 100%.</font></div><div style="line-height:174%;padding-bottom:4px;padding-top:16px;text-align:left;font-size:11pt;"><font style="font-family:inherit;font-size:11pt;">Second-quarter</font><font
